com.stockticker.persistence

Class UserDAOImpl

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.stockticker.persistence.UserDAOImpl
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    UserDAO

    public class UserDAOImpl
extends Object
implements UserDAO

    Defines the data access methods for User related data. This class retrieves an instance of the PersistenceConnection object and will initiate the start sequence if a connection is not currently available.

    Version:
    1.0 2/17/14.
    Author:
    Stuart Connall
    See Also:
    UserDAO, PersistenceConnection, PersistenceServiceException

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      UserDAOImpl()
      Constructs the UserDAO implementation instance.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      User create(String username, String password)
      Creates a row in the user table and stores the username and password.
      boolean delete(String username)
      Deletes the user row associated with the username and rows in both child tables, userinfo and tracked_stocks with associated userId values.
      boolean exists(String username)
      Checks if the user exists
      User get(String username)
      Gets the user row associated with the user name
      List<String> getLoggedInUsers()
      Returns a list of logged in users.
      int getUserId(String username)
      Gets the userId associated with the specified user name
      boolean isLoggedIn(String username)
      Checks if the user is currently logged in
      boolean setLoginStatus(String username, boolean status)
      Set a user's logged in status to true or false
      boolean update(User user)
      Updates the user data

    • Constructor Detail

      • UserDAOImpl

        public UserDAOImpl()
            throws PersistenceServiceException
        Constructs the UserDAO implementation instance. First it retrieves the PersistenceConnection instance and invokes its start method if a connection has not yet been established. Additionally, the log4j logger is setup for usage.
        Throws:
        PersistenceServiceException - is thrown when a failure occurs in the PersistenceConnection service such as failure to access the properties file or some sort of error during creation or accessing of the database.

              throws PersistenceServiceException
        Gets the userId associated with the specified user name
        Specified by:
        getUserId in interface UserDAO
        Parameters:
        username - the name of the user
        Returns:
        the user id, -1 otherwise
        Throws:
        PersistenceServiceException - this exception typically occurs when there is something wrong with the SQL statement or a connection is not available. The latter should not occur as checks should have already been done by the time this method is invoked.
